Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw a fish in its natural water habitat, showing clear understanding of what a fish might look like and where it lives.
The student can label the water as a resource needed by the fish to survive, indicating that they understand water's role.
The student can include and label some other living things, such as aquatic plants or a few other fish, portraying the habitat's biodiversity.
The student can show and label additional resources like rocks and plants, though some may only be partly labeled or missing labels.
The student can illustrate how the fish interacts with water for survival, such as swimming or using gills for breathing, though details might be simple or implied.
The student can demonstrate that the water habitat is a system where many parts work together, though connections between elements may be more implicit than explicit.
CANNOT: The student might inconsistently label all elements, sometimes forgetting to label certain parts like rocks or plants (incomplete labeling).

The student might have difficulty representing the full complexity of the habitat system, such as intricate relations between different living and non-living elements (partial understanding of interactions).
